snippet.textDisplay:
My first game was Donkey Kong Country and I think it has greatly influenced me to this day. I think it shaped my appreciation for both more methodical platformers and of course excellent and atmospheric video game soundtracks!

On an aside, the second game I ever played was Uniracers on SNES, and I would mark out so hard if you ever put its music on your playlist. It had some really great (if repetitive) heavy rock.

snippet.textDisplay: This game was also the very first game I played EVER. My dad bought a NES with The Legend of Zelda, TMNT 2 Arcade and Blades of Steel at a swap meet in Los Angeles. For about an hour he thought he bought a bum system as we could not get it to work, but after some magic taps and blowing on the cartridge we got them to work, Zelda was the first. I'm not sure what got my dad to buy those games, but I think the fact that LoZ was gold was a key reason lol.

First game I actually owned was Pokemon Red for the Gameboy, but Pokemon Blue was the first game I beat by myself (Mario world was always co-op with brother or mom, and my brother had to beat bowser for us every time).  I still have my pokemon red copy, the blue broke though :(
snippet.textOriginal:
First game I played through was Super Mario World on the SNES, but I had an older brother and mom that enjoyed gaming, so who knows what I picked up before that just for a few minutes.  

First game I actually owned was Pokemon Red for the Gameboy, but Pokemon Blue was the first game I beat by myself (Mario world was always co-op with brother or mom, and my brother had to beat bowser for us every time).  I still have my pokemon red copy, the blue broke though :(

snippet.textDisplay:
This theme gets stuck in my head as a reminder on how much the dungeons would piss me off.
You know how even one of the greatest games can still make you curse all existence? Beleive it or not; this game did all because of one type of enemy.
Those fucking knights!! They can only be killed anywhere but the front; their patterns are too random, and they swarm all over you. In the fifth dungeon you have to kill liek twelve of them to get the flute.
Seriously though..I fucking hate those knights!

snippet.textDisplay:
TMNT 2: The Arcade Game

A guy across the street had what probably was the only NES in my hometown and his little brother was in first grade in elementary with me. So when I was at his house, all we did was play the game, except for when it was the big brother's turn, when he would show us how it was done (I never got any further than stage 3 myself). I think I was 4 years old. The second game I played was either SMB3 (it's the second game the brother bought) or Prince of Persia on PC.

snippet.textDisplay:
My first game was likely the original Super Mario Bros.

I've been gaming since my earliest memories, and am gaming in my most recent.  But it's like reading novels or watching TV or listening to music - you do it your whole life, and you'll gain a love and appreciation for both the successes and its failures, the highs and lows..

Nearly a decade and a half of gaming history have I seen; may many more decades follow, for me and all fellow gamers, lifelong, or fresh from their first console.
